alert.note: Alert for Chilton (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 6:42PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Chilton and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Calera, Chelsea, Clanton, Childersburg, Columbiana, Jemison, Wilsonville, Vincent, Thorsby, Harpersville, Westover, Lay Lake, Gap Of The Mountain, Shelby, Highway 145 and CR 46, Spring Creek, Beeswax Creek Park, Alabama 4H Center, Kelley Branch and Waxahatchee Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
